title: Facebook bans deepfake videos from platforms
text: Facebook announced it will be cracking down and banning certain manipulated videos including deepfake videos. The policy will not apply to parody and satire. Yahoo Finance's Zack Gutman, Heidi Cheung and author of 'The CEO's Digital Marketing Playbook,' Thomas Donohue discuss Facebook's new policy.

title: Top Facebook exec: Yes, we got Trump elected and it may happen again
text: A Facebook executive who backed Hillary Clinton's 2016 election campaign told colleagues in an internal memo last month that the platform could ultimately be responsible for President Trump's reelection.

title: Top Facebook exec says Trump ran the best digital ad campaign ever in 2016
text: Facebook Vice President Andrew "Boz" Bosworth said the company was responsible for getting President Donald Trump elected in the 2016 U.S. election because "he ran the single best digital ad campaign I've ever seen from any advertiser.

title: Don’t Tilt Scales Against Trump, Facebook Executive Warns
text: In an internal memo, Andrew Bosworth said he “desperately” wanted the president to lose. But, he said, the company should avoid hurting Mr. Trump’s campaign.

title: Facebook Shares Plan To Ban Deepfakes
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) announced on Tuesday it will remove videos modified by artificial intelligence known as “deepfakes” from its platform.

title: Facebook Bans Deepfake Videos Ahead of 2020 US Elections
text: Facebook (FB) announces that it will ban misleading manipulated media - including edited images and deepfakes ahead of the U.S. presidential elections in 2020.

title: Facebook tries to curb deepfake videos as 2020 election heats up
text: Facebook has launched a new policy aimed at curbing highly-convincing videos known as deepfakes that have been manipulated using artificial intelligence.

title: Facebook Is Cracking Down On Deepfakes, But Loopholes For Disinformation Remain
text: Facebook vowed to ban deceptive videos edited using artificial intelligence ahead of the 2020 election but its new rules do not address less sophisticated fakes.

title: Facebook bans deepfakes in the runup to 2020 election, but ‘shallowfakes’ still allowed
text: But Facebook says its new deepfake policy does not apply to parody or satirical content, leaving room for users to argue their deepfakes should remain on the platform.

title: Facebook defies China headwinds with new ad sales push
text: Facebook Inc is setting up a new engineering team in Singapore to focus on its lucrative China advertising business, according to three people familiar with the effort, even as chief executive Mark Zuckerberg ramps up criticism of a country that blocks the social network.

title: Facebook bans deceptive deepfakes and some misleadingly modified media
text: Facebook wants to be the arbiter of truth after all. At least when it comes to intentionally misleading deepfakes and heavily manipulated and/or synthesized media content, such as AI-generated photorealistic human faces that look like real people but aren’t.
